Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Holly B
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely above-average for the price. The rooms are large and well-designed, with comfortable chairs for watching TV and a kitchenette with small dining table. The rooms are clean, comfy, quiet, with good air quality. Staff are friendly; breakfast is a real breakfast buffet, not just some muffins and juice. Two drawbacks: if you have a van or other large vehicle I'd go for the private lot across the street over the hotel's underground parking -- very narrow, twisty one-lane exit/entrance. And the immediate surroundings are rather seedy -- it's a very short walk to a nicer area, but if I were a women staying alone there I'd definitely cab it back at night. The location is, however, central and just a block the Metro.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best cheapest you can find in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: 250Traveller250
Reviews.Content: its clean, economic. workers are friendly. good breakfast service, rooms are clean, no smells no nothing. parking passes are available but they charge tax extra???? the parking is one way path but it is used for two ways, so you might wanna watch out there but all in all its secured. they only need some work in the parking, other than that everything seems pretty good and looks like you are in a good star hotel. good place close to downtown areas, to old montreal. not much of views there but you can walk and do your things.

Reviews.Title: “Why stay elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Amon029
Reviews.Content: Reasonable price, convenient location, friendly staff, clean & conformable room... why would you stay elsewhere!!! Arrived at 12pm, was told the room wasn't ready. But reception offered to store my luggage away. Came back around 2:30pm, room still ain't ready; but guaranteed it will be okay by 3pm. So I find a nearby coffee shop, besides it started to rain heavily outside. When I went back the third time, the room is finally ready. Later, I checked the hotel's website, the check-in time is 4pm. It's my fault for not noting it earlier. The room is fully equipped with kitchenette; no strange smell in the room tho. Two layers window and computer adjustable air con will keep you warm. Bed are comfortable. Bathroom is a bit smaller compare to my standard, but acceptable. Free buffet breakfast is a bonus. Above all, it sits within 1 min walk to Berri-uqam Station (exit from Sainte-Catherine St). Berri-uqam is the interchange stop for Metro Line 1, 2, & 4; it is also the departure point for airport express bus 747. Heaps restaurants, coffee shops around it. IGA super market is 2 mins away. Once again, why would you stay elsewhere in Montreal?

Reviews.Title: “rough street, but great value hotel”
Reviews.Author: RHHansen
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our 4th anniversary and staying at this hotel. Without a GPS its hard to find and is on a one way street. PROS: CLEAN!, huge rooms, comfy beds and pillows, flatscreen t.v and cable, clean and new bathroom, kitchenette with hot plate and microwave, FULL HOT BREAKFAST, taxi service right behind hotel and fast, close to old montreal (about 8 min drive) and close to all the downtown touristy things to do. We walked everywhere!, parking lot right accross the street same price as hotel and we could see our car from our room, very quiet in our room, couldn't not hear neighbours at all, water was always high pressure CONS: Staff didn't greet you each time you enter the hotel, hotel underground lot VERY small and tight, WIFI was not available all the time (had to go downstairs to look up directions), on a grungy street/alleyway and scary to walk at night, every March 15 there is an annual riot so of course we did not know this until we coldn't get to the hotel for 2 hours so stay away on that day, don't allow pets, no pool. Thats all I think, PROS outweighed the cons and would stay here again for sure. Paid $80 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value! Best deal out there by far!”
Reviews.Author: Lovin D
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! Very quiet, clean and very friendly staff! The room was quite large, the kitchenette was very handy. Breakfast was great! We were visiting for just four days and were not in the room often, but we were very comfortable when we were. The beds were very comfortable, the bathroom was spacious and clean. I'd highly recommend this hotel. For the price, it's an amazing deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: Never having been to Montreal before, this was a total shot in the dark. I originally picked Les Suites Labelle because of the combination of location and price. Reading the other reviews, this seemed like a great choice and now that we're back, I'm so glad we picked it. When using Google maps to get to this location from New York State, it directs you to an adjacent hotel. Don't worry-- you'll see LSL once you're on Rue Labelle. LSL is conveniently located right near the Berri-UQAM stop on the metro, which made it easy to get all over Montreal. We liked the location because it was in a fun neighborhood-- it's in the Latin Quarter, adjacent to the Gay Village, a short walk to China Town and a longer (though very manageable, in our opinion) walk to Old Montreal. The rooms themselves were great-- clean, fresh and had a kitchenette. The shower head was actually taller than me (rare) and the bed was really comfortable. Our stay included breakfast, which was great and offered a solid variety of meal options (we're vegan and vegetarian and even we found something to eat!). The only downsides were that my coat fell on the floor and the heater tore/burned several holes in it (a flukey thing but something to watch out for-- I wouldn't be concerned about the safety of the heater, though, because my coat ended up under the the bottom part of the heater... just don't let that happen) and the woman at the front desk was not very friendly. Everything else was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Very good apartment hotel in latin quarter”
Reviews.Author: ALLIGATOR9
Reviews.Content: Big comfortable room with kitchenette, dining area and a big bathroom. Conveniently located in Latin Quarter within 2mins of station, superb choice of bars & restaurants within walking distance. Lively neighborhood and a long walk can take you to the Old Town. Good breakfast and nice staff. No fancy stuff though has a lobby and a reception. Great option for long stays.

Reviews.Title: “Jolene”
Reviews.Author: Jolene320
Reviews.Content: Great location! Close to the metro, loads of shops, restaurants, pubs, bars. Clean and quiet. The breakfast is an amazing deal since its free and was delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing value, great location, and breakfast was included!”
Reviews.Author: Heinsenberg
Reviews.Content: Located in the heart of downtown, it was easy to get around by walking. Our room had a kitchen included with dishes, everything was very clean and staff were friendly. Only downside was the tv..no ppv channels and the tube tv was hung from the ceiling, furniture was kind of old fashioned looking. Breakfast was included and wifi Internet as well (but kind of slow). We would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Daniel M
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night in Winter as a stop over on our way to Quebec City. The location was good, close to Old Town and close enough to a good choice of shops and restaurants. We drove and underground parking was very convenient (for a fee) although very tight corners! Our room was huge, more of an apartment style layout than a hotel, had a kitchenette and sofa, we appreciated the extra space. Beds were comfortable enough, room decor was fairly old fashioned, gave the impression that all the furniture had been in use for a long time, not necessarily a bad thing, but I always like seeing new modern style decor that makes you feel like you might not be the 1 millionth person to lie on the bed even if that's not the case! Overall it was a pleasant stay with no problems, unfortunately we left too early to sample the included breakfast, so I can't comment on that! I would recommend this hotel to all travellers who aren't too fussy and especially to those on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tiago O
Reviews.Content: Nice realtion cost X benefit. Good location and great breakfast. The room is big and the satff friendly. The parking lot is in the second floor under the ground and there isn't a elevator to get there. To get there you need to get out of the hotel and the place is not very well frequented. Besides that, the hole experience was great.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, centrally located, free breakfast, good for the money”
Reviews.Author: bfd7
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with my recent stay at Les Suites Labelle. Our rate was less than $100 per night, including parking and complimentary breakfast. Our room was large enough and clean. We weren't looking for modern polish or frills in this price range. Travelers should know that the street of the hotel, while only 1 block from the UQAM metro station, is a side street with some abandoned buildings and sketchy street people hanging around. We always felt safe, but a less adventurous solo traveler might have a problem with this. It was everything we wanted for this price range.

Reviews.Title: “Walkable to Old Town & Chinatown”
Reviews.Author: LCLee
Reviews.Content: Photo looks better. However, room is clean, no frill and very Ikea like furniture. Bathroom looks better than sleeping room. Little kitchenette for those who want to cook. We never used it since we ate out. Chinatown only about 5 blocks away. Old town also about 5 - 6 blocks away. Shopping mall up the street about 7-8 blocks away. Parking lot outside the hotel charged $ 15.00 overnight - in by 3 PM and out before noon. Also metro around the corner. Hallway looks a bit run down. Continental breakfast included various types of cereals, pastries/croissants, baked beans, cut fruit bowl, scrambled eggs, diced potatoes (very salty), and little sausages (husband said these tasted nasty), with beverages. Breakfast was filling. Okay place to stay. The night before, we stayed at the Hampton Inn by Dorval Airport and that was about 10 minutes away with free parking, larger stylist rooms and made to order waffles with continental breakfast for under $ 100.00.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lilydent
Reviews.Content: Very clean hotel, big room I have (stayed for one night). Nice kitchenette with a lot of stuff in it, it was very helpfull for my dinner preparation. The hotel doesn't provide filtered drinking water. You are paying extra fees for parking ($15 for one night) and the garage isn't convinient because passage is very narrow, so it's hard to park there. The location is excellent. I would return there next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the price point!”
Reviews.Author: rita f
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3-night stay at Labelle, and we were really, really happy with the whole experience! While it's not a luxury hotel in the heart of Vieux Montreal, if you're looking to spend about $115/night, I can't see doing better than this. The location is super-convenient - after we parked*, we didn't move the car until we left, and were able to walk or take the metro everywhere. The station is under a block from the hotel and is a major hub connecting 3 subway lines. While Labelle street itself is rather run-down, it's certainly safe, well-lit, and quiet. It was less than 10 minutes' walk to the old port. (*Yes, as other reviewers have noted, the parking garage is a tight squeeze, but if you don't have a giant SUV and are used to parking in old cities not designed for lots of cars, it's not that bad.) The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. They made solid recommendations and sent us to a great little jazz club on Saint Denis. The breakfast is huge - one of the few times I'm glad the rest of the world thinks Americans are fatsos who can't get enough potatoes. The room was definitely on the large size - I've lived in smaller apartments. It was really clean. The windows actually opened!! And there was a heart-shaped jacuzzi for two! And although we ate out for every meal, it was really nice having a kitchenette with fridge and microwave and toaster. Maybe other rooms have hard beds, but we slept like comfortable logs. I'd absolutely stay here again on my next trip to Montreal!

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: CRS111
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights on a recent visit to Montreal. The rooms are okay, and certainly not luxurious in any way. They have a nice enough bathroom, a small television and coffee making facilities, and a kitchenette with sink etc (there was a warning on the kitchenette that there would be a fine of $25 if any unwashed dishes were left in room after checking out). The customer service was virtually non-existent, and the reception staff were generally unfriendly and made no attempt to show any interest in their customers. As other reviewers have mentioned, the hotel entrance is on a rather dodgy sidestreet, although there is not really much the hotel could do about this. It is more of a quiet road linking two main streets and it never really made my partner or I feel unsafe, but I can imagine solo females may feel nervous about walking along it, but the area seemed pretty safe. It is around a 10-15 minute walk from the hotel to Old Montreal and Chinatown, while the area the hotel is in is next to the University of Quebec/Montreal. St Catherines Street is a 30 second walk from the hotel and has a large number of shops, restaurants, bars etc. The Berri-UQAM metro station is also around a minute walk from the hotel, as is the bus station where the Airport 747 Express bus arrives/departs. Breakfast was included in the room price which we paid, and this was a standard hot buffet (sausage, eggs, beans, toast, cereal etc). My favourite bit of the hotel was the roof patio, a small area on the 9th floor where there were tables to sit out at, and good views of the city. This was good to sit with a drink at night before or after going out for a meal. There is also a small gym on the 9th floor but it was very dingy and the equipment looked cheap and tired. I would recommend this hotel if you are visiting Montreal on a tight budget, or are going to be spending very little time in the hotel. However, if I was to go back I would probably spend a little more to stay somewhere better (and closer to Old Montreal).

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kfc_sda
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Metro and yummy continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, recommended!”
Reviews.Author: hundl1ng
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Les Suites Labelle for two nights in September 2011. All in all, I can definitely recommend that place. It's a great location, the area is safe and there's a metro station just around the corner. If you take the 747 bus from the aiport make sure to get out at Berri-UQAM. The hotel is only two minutes away. You can also walk downtown, it's about 15 minutes. The breakfast is more than enough (bread, eggs, cornflakes, etc.), it's a buffet as well, so you can eat as much as you want. The rooms are clean and spacy enough. At night you might hear some of the noise from the surrounding nightlife locations but for me this was no problem at all. Free internet included. To sum up, it's great value for the money. I didn't regret going there!

Reviews.Title: “Large Rooms & Good Location”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGnome09
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1) the bedroom & bathroom were large 2) it was great to have a small kitchen area in the room 3) location was very close to the Berri Metro stop 4) very close to a inexpensive parking garage ($9 per 24hrs on the weekend & $12 per 24hrs on the weekend) 5) close to the Village 6) the staff were very nice and welcoming. Negatives: 1) the beds were hard and uncomfortable 2) the pillows were lumpy and uncomfortable 3) the rug in the room looked old and a bit dirty. Overall, not a bad place. Would possibly stay again because of the location and friendliness of the staff.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Mutter1
Reviews.Content: We had a queen studio with a kitchenette (which we never used). The room was very big. Furniture is simple and utilitarian. TV is old and wasn't working when we checked in. We told the front desk when we went out, and by the time we returned after 4 hours, it was repaired. We found the location excellent; it's right next to the Latin Quarter and only less than 10 min away from the Old Port on foot. Breakfast is great. As a matter of fact, we enjoyed the two breakfasts at Labelle more than all the other restaurants we went during the two days we were in Montreal. We used its underground parking which takes quite some skillful driving. There is nothnig plush about Labelle, but if what you are lookin for is cleaniness, convenience, safety and peace of mind, than Labelle serves those purposes extremely well.

Reviews.Title: “Not fancy, but very nice for the price.”
Reviews.Author: DashingThere
Reviews.Content: My room was clean and fairly new. It looked a little like an assisted living facility. But it has a great location, friendly staff, kitchenette in the room and good breakfast included. II you want elegant stay elsewhere, otherwise this is a good choice..

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Joshc12
Reviews.Content: Breakfast was good. Rooms were clean and great location. Except the parking garage is tight I scraped my rim going out of it. Corners are super tight be careful.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised. Don't judge a book by its cover ... or a hotel by its facade.”
Reviews.Author: mikeyj807
Reviews.Content: We spent a Saturday night in Montreal and booked this hotel online as we were en route from the U.S. My, what a find! The Labelle provided a comfortable but no frills stay and easy access to Vieux Montreal and the shops and restaurants of Rue Ste Catherine, even if Rue Labelle itself is a bit of a sketchy side street. But looks can be deceiving, and our suite offered a kitchenette and ample quiet for a good night's sleep. The American style buffet breakfast was a nice touch as well.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels I stayed in.......”
Reviews.Author: looper14
Reviews.Content: I never stayed in such a bad hotel...the location is near downtown however it's not very safe location... The parking is a disaster really, the front desk doesn't notify you about underground parking, the turns are so bad that if you have longer car, you will need to reverse in the turn otherwise you either hit the wall or don't turn at all....it is same entrance in and out and there is no sign anywhere when you entering the garage. It is not cheap either, I recommend that you check out the parking before you buy it for the night. there are few parking lots around. The room was clean with kitchenette but you don't find many glasses or cups for drinking however you will find lots of pots for cooking. The breakfast was o.k., no fruit or yogurt but you find nice pastry and scramble eggs and sausage. Tea selection is very bad(only orange pekoe which you find in the room) and there is lots of brew coffee. I find the front desk staff not very helpful, except the gentleman who works overnight. Otherwise they just check you in and don't explain anything. This hotel rooms are overpriced for the service you have, they are not cheap at all, you can find nicer hotels in Montreal for same price. Me or my family will never return there as it was a big disappointment and I been happy to not stay another night there....

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money. A few glitches but good service overall.”
Reviews.Author: GoCubs08
Reviews.Content: The service was friendly, prompt and competent. The batteries needed to be replaced in our TV remote and were at the next room cleaning. The elevators were a bit wonky. The big one that is used for luggage ceased working altogether for a about a day but we didn't need it during that time. My wife and I were on it at one point when it got stuck on the 6th floor. A bit scary for the moment but fortunately the door worked and we switched to the other, smaller elevator. Breakfast was good, though the same every day. The underground parking is tight but secure and worth the price. The hotel is quite clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints”
Reviews.Author: Dskwyra
Reviews.Content: I requested a quiet room and got same. The room was clean and maid service was excellent. The people at the front desk were very helpful in answering any questions I had relative to getting around in Montreal. Free breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “My husband and I had a very pleasant and agreeable stay. We hope to return in the future.”
Reviews.Author: bear924
Reviews.Content: I would start first with the location. Close to subway to connect with other areas of Montreal. Fortunately, very close to bus station Orleans Express which made our transfer to Quebec very easy. Room and bathroom well equipped and: spacious enough for two, kitchenette very handy even if you don't feel like cooking. Staff very kind, pleasant and helpful. Internet service very useful. Local free calls were of great help. To the breakfast buffet I would only add youghurt for those who do not tolerate milk. .Didn't have the chance nor time for Spa or swimming pool (a pity!) P.S. UNFORTUNATELY, WE DO NOT HAVE PHOTOES OF OUR TRIP. VERY STRANGE, BUT TRUE.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: ProfLiu
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on tripadvisor reviews and for the most part, we were not disappointed. The location is perfect. An easy walk to the Old Port, and about a block from a major Metro station (Berri/UQAM). Although it's not fancy, it is clean with comfortable rooms, and the breakfast was very good. It included fresh scrambled eggs, sausages, and potatoes in addition to a variety of breads and cereal. The free wireless internet was also a plus. There were, however, two downfalls. First, the poor quality of the television reception and the television itself. But we were there to see the city and attend a concert, not watch TV so we weren't too disappointed. The other downfall is the parking; the underground lot has a very steep and narrow ramp making it quite worrisome if one were to meet another car exiting while you are entering or vice versa. One or the other would have to back up. The spiral is also so tight and narrow that I scraped my bumper on the wall. The marks on the wall left by other drivers made clear that I was not alone in this mishap. When I mentioned it at check out, the desk staff didn't have much reaction.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved this place, can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: certgoil
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at some pretty awful hotels in MontrÃ©al, and Hotel Les Suites Labelle was 100x better than any of them, by far. Our whole family LOVED this place. I'm not sure why people say the area isn't nice, I'm guessing most haven't seen what the neighbourhoods look like in Downtown MontrÃ©al, because they all look very similar. I felt safe the whole time I was there. The room was very clean and spacious, perfect for a family visit. The breakfast that was included was yummy and fresh. The 1 minute walk to Berri UQAM was a bonus, along with the 5 minute walk to the IGA and SAQ stores. And as well, the service from everyone, from the front desk t the valet parking to the breakfast attendants was polite, informative and friendly. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great localization!”
Reviews.Author: cmo_matsuk
Reviews.Content: The hotel looks awful by the pictures and the website, but it is not! It's old, but is clean and the localization is great. I would definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, close to metro, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: jsp14
Reviews.Content: Everything was suitable, no complaints! Great that it was still available for the jazz festival. Good price.

Reviews.Title: “Feels like a basic student dorm”
Reviews.Author: Ginger1176
Reviews.Content: No frills, low quality finishings, linens etc, thin walls, not super clean. It felt like a bargain-level student room. That said, the location was excellent, and a kitchenette is a nice convenience esp. for a longer stay. Although I had no problems, I would pay a couple dollars more next time to have a more updated, brighter, cleaner and more comfortable space. Be warned there is no in-room safe for passports etc. Wi-fi was fast and free, though, which was great! And a hairdryer and coffee maker are provided amenities. For the price, I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best area, but convenient for metro”
Reviews.Author: Laura352
Reviews.Content: Only a couple of minutes walk from the Berri/UQAM metro entrance and 5 minutes from the central bus station where you can get a bus to the airport. Downside is that the hotel is down a not very nice side street with views of a car park. I travelled with my 15 yr old son and we saw 2 cars with smashed windows nearby and syringes in the street. Saying that, the hotel is clean, rooms are big, kitchenette is useful, breakfast was good and really filled up a hungry teenager. Walking distance from old Montreal where there is a huge choice of restaurants. Free wifi is a bonus.

Reviews.Title: “BLESSED QUIET”
Reviews.Author: nurse02818
Reviews.Content: I was in Montreal to compete in a Masters swim meet over the Victoria Day weekend . I needed to be at the pool early each day and therefore to be able to sleep well each night . Trip Advisor reviews and knowing that the hotel was very convenient to the Metro led me to choose this hotel . Just before I checked in , a large group of young people cheked in and I was a little leery about possible noise . There was no noise during any of the five nights I stayed there . I would be amazed at the number of guests eating breakfast each morning because the hotel always sounded like it must be nearly empty. The breakfast was great especially the little french pastries . A thoroughly enjoyable hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, some downsides”
Reviews.Author: Talentimo
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not a fancy place, but gives you a large, clean room and a great breakfast in a very central location. It is just blocks from the old town, the latin quarter, Ste Catherines St. shopping, etc. I stayed for 2 weeks and made good use of the kitchen and enjoyed the breakfast and the convenient access to the Metro. A couple of downsides: the immediate area is definitely downscale and may make solo female travelers uncomfortable. A lot of beggars and street people. The "fitness centre" is a very sad piece of work and they shouldn't even advertise it. I used the shakey, low-quality equipment a couple of times, but they should get rid of it or upgrade it. That's the only thing that would cause me to look for somewhere else to stay next time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the money - clean, large rooms, good breakfasts, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: lackrill
Reviews.Content: We've been to Montreal several times this past year because we have children at McGill and Concordia Universities. This weekend (April 30, May 1st) we went to pick up them up from university and needed to have a decent, clean, central place to stay for the night. This hotel was a gem. The rooms were large and spacious, it was very clean and the breakfasts were good. We were there on Sunday morning and the breakfasts were more than just basic - eggs, sausages, croissants, cereal, juice, etc. I want to thank Trip Advisor for the recommendation - I used the coupon for free parking (it was the last day that they offered the coupon). I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Very quiet and convenient location.”
Reviews.Author: richardanddolly
Reviews.Content: This location suited us perfectly. Service was good, breakfast had lots of choices, and the room was clean, comfortable, and very quiet. The computers available for guest use were old and software was not up-to-date making them almost useless. Other than that our stay exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel and good value, street appeal and location could be better.”
Reviews.Author: miketash
Reviews.Content: Stayed in suite room for 4 night. Suite room was very spacious and clean, queen bed was small but not too much to concern with. Breakfast was good but nothing too special, enough to get you started for the day. Hotel has a coin operated laundry on the first floor which was handy. Think the hotel was a renovated hospital as you can tell from the lay out. But it did not have an Erie feeling ar all. The staff were friendly and helpful. And rooms were serviced daily to a high standard. The location.. About a 20 minute walk from old Montreal or St Catherine shopping hub but very close by is the latin quarter which has some great eating spots. Also close by (at the end of the street) is Berri Subway station which is a connection station for all subway lines Very Useful and subway is a very safe way too get around. Main gripe is street that hotel is on, rue La Belle is dirty and desolate but all in all we felt safe and you can skip the street by walking through the well lite carpark directly in front of the hotel to the busier Rue Berri street.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and great value in downtown Montreal"”
Reviews.Author: Prince-O
Reviews.Content: Can't really add anything that hasn't already been said here. Nice, clean, large rooms with kitchenette (bonus!); large bathrooms with great shower. And yes, they match pricing or have their own specials online which beat ANYTHING in the surround neghborhood. Trust me, we have a group here all staying near L'Olympia and we have the best rate (and arguably best value for the quakity of our hotel vs. cost). One of our group contacted thir sales department about a block of rooms for us and they were MORE than helpful and even beat their current online special ( which was only $5 or $10 higher so still a great bargain).

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: MackVilla
Reviews.Content: 99% was excellent, next time I will book directly to the hotel as they can match the prices of other websites as Expedia, Travelocity, Air Canada, etc... so I can have my rewards points I think they give one free night after 8 or 9 stays ;) p.s. only one comment, I got a room in the 2nd floor and it was a little bit noice `cause the elevator, but it was not a bid deal :)

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: tanguera444
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect at this place. It is very clean, the rooms are perfectly equipped and the location is great in the center of the city walking distance to many nice places. The small kitchenette in the room is very practical. Would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Midrange at a budget price”
Reviews.Author: JackFrancis
Reviews.Content: The downtown location was great. The suite was huge and free wifi was a plus. The breakfasts were passable, but this was the only slight downer on a great value option for Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice. roomy suite”
Reviews.Author: funtimes0652
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was close to the bus station where the Greyhound came in. Not the classiest area and Rue Labelle is a bit of a 'sorry' side street but we found it easy to walk up Rue St Catherine to the main shopping area and it was very close to Berri Metro station. The hotel room was very roomy with a spacious bathroom and full kitchenette. The beds were comfortable and the double glazed windows meant we heard little outside noise. The room was clean and we'd definitely stay there again. The reception staff were fairly typical - polite but not particularly friendly. The breakfast was good although there was no fresh fruit available. I would not hesitate to recommend a stay in Les Suites Labelle if you want good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Good value central hotel with all the basics right and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: WorldTraveller186225
Reviews.Content: This is a good value hotel with all expected facilities and some additional ones like in house laundry and very helpful staff (in English and French). The buffet breakfast is excellent and the rooms are clean and of a good size and facilities. The location is good close to shops and restaurants and very close to the metro for going elsewhere although the street itself is perhaps not ideal for lone women at night (quite a few beggars etc). All in all good value, well equiped hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again for sure!”
Reviews.Author: ensign89
Reviews.Content: Great Location, large clean room, huge bathroom, friendly staff, WiFi works really well, Breakfast was limited but of good quality. This hotel would be our first choice if we were to come to montreal again.

Reviews.Title: “basic but affordable & no complaints”
Reviews.Author: newyoika
Reviews.Content: room is small & basic (definitely not luxurious in any way), but clean - affordable - and within walking distance from the airport bus which is nice! staff was very kind, friendly, helpful. my stay was very quick, but i had no complaints. would stay again, although i was a little put off by the sign saying you would be charged extra if you didnt wash the dishes in the kitchenette. i didnt use the dishes, but used the coffee maker, cup, & spoon before checking out - and had to take the time to wash them all before rushing off to make a flight, which isn't really standard in my opinion. free wifi worked great, which is important to me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly fine for the price - but not so friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Meganhalifax
Reviews.Content: Hotel Labelle is located near the Berri/UQAM metro station making is a super convenient hotel. Yes, the street it's on is pretty awful but seriously- the street is so short and then you're on St. Catharine's! It is located by lots of restaurants, cafes and shopping. Staff: We found he front desk staff to be somewhat unpleasant. We didn't like their attitude. Also- we noticed on the website that parking was supposed to be free for Fall however it was not. Rooms: The room was clean and had everything we needed. However, the bed was like sleeping on concrete. Still, for the price and location it was somehow worth it! Parking: The parking garage is pretty rough. We drove a Hyundai Accent in so luckily we were small enough to fit. But geeze, don't go with an SUV or VAN! I cannot imagine how you would make the turns!!!! Bottom line: If you are looking for a cheaper place to stay with good free breakfast just do it. It was easy to find and we enjoyed our stay over all.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money.”
Reviews.Author: aussiecoupleBrisbane
Reviews.Content: This hotel was within easy walking distance of lots of restaurants & shops, and a short distance from the Metro. We found the staff very helpful, the room comfortable with kitchenette, free internet in the lobby, and a reliable laundry. The breakfast was adequate although we found the food in warmers exactly that - only warm.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, beds were just OK”
Reviews.Author: ladybug314
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nicely furnished, but the beds were just OK. Had free continental breakfast every morning but there was no variety or change of menu.

Reviews.Title: “What a great place”
Reviews.Author: garnet8
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I only spent one night in this hotel and it was wonderful. It was a nice size, very very clean. The bathroom was HUGE. The breakfast that was included with the stay was very nice, it was a proper breakfast. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. We tried to get another night but they were all booked and no wonder, the location is fantastic. I would go back to this hotel for sure!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nothing Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: Banditgal
Reviews.Content: Location was great, as it was near St Catherine's pedestrians area, Latin District, Hop Skip and Jump to Old Town. A draw back was the parking garage. Tight fitting, not many spaces in the two levels assigned to the hotel and only one way in and out. The area, did smell a bit funny lots of urine smells from the bums that lived on the streets, but then again I smelt that all over Montreal. Nothing fancy, just a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service, CLEAN CLEAN CLEAN”
Reviews.Author: sjohnson73107
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Great location. Very clean hotel. Near the Berri metro station and by the BIXI bike docking station. The gym sucks, they should close it down and offer vouchers for the Gym down the street on St. Cathering (about 5 minute walk ). Bed was a bit hard. Staff extremely helpful and very courteous!!! Breakfast comes with room, very nice, good food, great options. Street is old... Pretty much empty. Has well lit parking lots infront of it and on the side of it. Cannot say enough about this hotel. Great bang for the buck. I would suggest they get rid of chest of drawers and get a nice size dresser to put your baggage on top of (space was a little of an issue in the room).

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Herbie47
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff; good continental breakfast (included); very clean room with nice view of Olympic stadium (room 811); nice kitchenette in the room. Internet discount. Can't really say anything negative about this hotel, other than parking is $15/day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: ScubySue
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel was a bit bare bones, I would stay here again. Plentiful breakfast, reasonable rates and clean room. Bed was not super comfortable but OK for a couple of nights. Staff very helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “We were impressed!”
Reviews.Author: vermonter212
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel at a great price. The room was spacious and had a kitchenette with microwave and fridge (which we weren't expecting but were quite happy about!). Room was very clean and quiet. The front desk staff was knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. And the location is great - easy walking to many places (we walked to Old Montreal) and subway is about two blocks away. The only negative, and it's nothing major, is that the parking garage underneath the hotel is really tight. We were in a small car so it wasn't a problem. But if we had driven a truck or larger SUV, it would have been pretty precarious.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: orangeman
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights with my sister and baby niece. We booked through their site online for a winter discount with free parking and it was really cheap for what we got (about $80/night inclusive). Positives: -Big enough room with two beds, playpin, kitchen area with table/chairs, TV and big sofa seat. Large bathroom as well. -Service was excellent. Called ahead and they set up playpin and put us away from neighbours for baby's sleep. Always polite and nice attitude at the front desk. -Included breakfast was big and pretty good. Eggs, potatoes, toast, juice, coffee, pastries, sausages. -Steps from Berri-UQAM metro (orange and green lines). -Everything you need within 10 minute walk: IGA, dollar stores, great restaurants, SAQ (liquor store), etc. The Latin Quarter, St. Laurent, Old Port, gay village and downtown are all walking distance and like I said, the two major metros stop right there anyway. -It was clean, no complaints about that. Negatives -Although the neighbourhood is good the street is run-down and pretty deserted with boarded up shops. Like a scene form a movie, actually. However, I never felt threatened and even my sister with the baby didn't feel suspicious. There were other families staying there walking around and we didn't hear of any situations. It just looks bad. In any case, there are major roads at both ends and on either side so it's not like the area is deserted. -The parking garage, which is 2 or 3 floors down, has no elevator. This is usually not such a big deal, but when you have a baby and all that entails those stairs start to add up. Overall I was very satisfied and would stay here again. Really, if this place was just a few doors down at the corner of the busy road it would cost a lot more. I used to live in Montreal and love this area. It takes 2 minutes of walking down a dark road to the main one and that's the discount you're getting.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not the best place to stay for a BRIGHT and HAPPY vacation in Montreal!”
Reviews.Author: HusbandDJ
Reviews.Content: One thing is for certain, I definitely won't be going back here, as this place is not the place to stay on a honeymoon or vacation! The hotel was a real challenge trying to find the street it was located on. The street itself, right away sent off bad vibes as there was a lot of closed up shops and run down fixtures (not a place to be walking around in the middle of the night!). The underground parking was full when we arrived so my car had to sit in a small 6 spot lot that was outside next to the building. It's a good thing I have a small car and I am good at driving in reverse, as well as parallel parking or I would have been out of luck getting in that lot. The room my wife and I got was on the third floor. This hotel has two elevators, one is VERY large and the other is VERY small. So if you happen to have a cart full of luggage you are out of luck if you get the small elevator! Our first impression of the room was most definitely NOT what we saw on its website. The rooms are very dark and 'sad', and the walls kind of lead you to believe you are in a basement. After being in the room for a few minutes, you could sense a lingering scent...perhaps mold?...though I certainly hope it wasn't that. We had to go and get our room switched but they wanted to charge us extra for a 'better' room. We told them we would be leaving the next morning instead of staying all 3 nights to go to a different hotel. The staff then offered us the 'better' room at no extra charge in desperation to keep us there for the full 3 nights. The 'better' room seemed to have newer furniture but thats about it... and they tell you the beds are queen, but they are clearly double beds. The wireless internet is only available in half the building, but there is wired everywhere else (bring your own internet cable!). Though our new room was a little nicer than the last, the view out the window made up for it...run down alley way with small private parking for the backing lots as well as a mess of construction in the property next door. The rooms are not that quiet... I instinctively whispered while we were there because we could hear noises in the next room, people in the hallway opening and slamming doors, and of course, the construction happening outside. I didn't really get a good night's sleep as I woke up to a stuffed up nose and sneezing in the morning. This hotel is advertised as a NON-Smoking hotel and there are also signs in the building that say 'no smoking' but the hallway on our floor had a very strong smell of cigarette smoke which sent me into a sneezing fit on the elevator and gave my wife a headache. The breakfast was...OK... nothing too special, but it did have a free hot buffet. The eggs... i don't know if they were half cooked or what, but they certainly weren't your traditional scrambled eggs... The bakery selection they had looked good but a lot of it was dried out. The only fruits I saw offered was fruit salad which had that familiar taste that it came out of a can. No bacon though... I don't know any other hotel that doesn't serve bacon with the eggs at a buffet! Don't book the 2.5 star hotel through Hotwire in downtown Montreal or you might make the same mistake we did! We did not stay the full 3 nights and ended up leaving the morning after we arrived. Hotwire was very helpful in resloving this issue and got us situated in a much nicer and cleaner hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel in poor location”
Reviews.Author: SebsBoulder
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand why so many people gave a good grade to this hotel. The location is central but the street is little trashy and the neighbourhood is safe but not nice (sex bars and movies...). I would not bring my children there! The room was small but correct and clean. No charm and cheap materials but just ok. The breakfast was very mediocre. Employees were nice though (canadian). For the price we paid (US $105 per night + Can $15 parking), we were desappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Never underestimate free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: bridgetravels
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very clean. For the price we paid which was around 120.00 it was great deal. Our room was basic, no frills here but was spacious enough and included a kitchenette in which we were able to make lunch and one dinner during our stay. There is a IGA grocery store about a block away. With children it is always great to have a place to put the milk. Breakfast included hot options such as eggs, hash browns, and beans. I rwill never underestimate free breakfast again. It saves not only money but site seeing time as well. I wouldn't understand this until we drove up to Quebec City and spent 30 dollars and an hour of time on breakfast every day. The alley is alittle sketchy however there are lighted parking lots that stradle either side of the hotel. We would cut across those instead of walking down the alley at night. I used the metro station which was at the end of the street with no problems. Supoer convienent. Overall this is a hip area with a mostly young crowd. I would recommend this hotel for people in there 20s and 30s who want to be close to the nightlife. Overall we had a great experience

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly lovely experience . . .”
Reviews.Author: JRW5362
Reviews.Content: I came for the music festival "Red Hot and Blue" Rockabilly" weekender, which was awesome (@Lion D'ior)! I stayed at Les Suites La Belle. The room was splendid and cozy as well as quiet. It was not large but not too small! Some reviews worried me on this account; I've stayed at smaller in Chicago! The kitchenette was handy and cool ALTHO there is so much food in the neighborhood (even late at night) I only used it a bit. I enjoyed the breakfast. It went from 7 AM to 11 AM, which was nice for a late riser such as myself! The staff was pleasant and always helpful. The neighborhood is fantastic; rue la belle is just off rue ST Catherine where there is so much to see and do. Art installations and live multi-media events were happening SAT night, as well as wonderful street musicians.

Reviews.Title: “perfect for me in every way”
Reviews.Author: actempe
Reviews.Content: I booked my flight and hotel through Travelocity and got a very good rate. The location is ideal: within easy walking distance of downtown, Old Montreal, the Village, and Chinatown, and just a block from the largest Metro station in Montreal. The decor is utilitarian and efficient, not elegant. The room was perfectly clean, the bed comfortable, and I never heard a sound from another room. Double windows kept out most of the street noise, which was minor anyway. The kitchenette would have been useful if I'd wanted to eat in. All the staff I encountered at the front desk are bilingual (French and English) and helpful. The complimentary breakfast was excellent. Free internet in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “An unexpected pleasure -- a great stay for cheap!”
Reviews.Author: lostathome77
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for three nights during our visit to Montreal. We'd spent an additional two nights at Hotel XIXe Siecle in Vieux Montreal prior to this. We found our room to be very pleasant. It was actually furnished with a fully equipped kitchen area outside of the usual amenities, which would be great for lengthy visits. Wireless internet is not available outside the ground floor, however, if you ask the front desk for a cable, you can have a wired high-speed internet connection in your room. TV reception was a little fuzzy, but we didn't watch much. Staff is very friendly and helpful. It seemed that someone was always at the front desk. Parking is underground, unless you have an SUV like we did. You will then be asked to park outside the hotel in a lot for C$15/day. Our car was fine for the length of the trip. We also had breakfast free as part of our stay. It's actually a decent selection. Just don't expect gourmet chefs whipping you up omelettes. So the surroundings seem to be the thing that this place has going against it. The street doesn't look great, and there's a construction spot down the road. It's also a one-way street, and the only way to access the hotel is by making a right from Rue St Catherine or cutting across a parking lot. But if you're willing to look past this first impression, you'll find that Les Suites Labelle is in a great spot for a walking tourist. You're less than 5 minutes away from a big metro station (Berri/UQAM). You're even about a 20 minute walk from the Promenade and Vieux Montreal. Also, you're very close to a number of the most interesting streets downtown if you want to look around. Don't hesitate to walk or use the Metro -- it feels like the best way to get around. Highly recommended if you're looking to save some cash and want a decent place to crawl into bed after exploring Montreal.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: pkruger777
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, quiet, with a kitchenette that was well equiped for preparing food in the room. A good breakfast was included. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was very clean and spacious. The location is good in that it is near the metro, restaurants and walkable to old Montreal. In the area there are some dodgy characters around but nothing to be worried about and the streets about have ' an atmosphere'. I recommend renting the new bikes available from the numerous bike stands around the city. Overall I think the hotel is very good value and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient location and helpful sfaff”
Reviews.Author: vladb
Reviews.Content: Comfortable, quiet (at least the top floor) rooms with kitchen amenities, walking distance to both the old city and the university area with plentiful nightlife. The staff was very accommodating and even assisted us with finding some quality beer bars in the area (which we didn't need much help with because of the free internet at our disposal in the lobby). The apparent sketchiness of the nearby St-Cathernines area did not bother us. Worth the value if booked on any discount hotel website.

Reviews.Title: “How much time do you spend in the immediate neighborhood anyway?”
Reviews.Author: BEGWIB
Reviews.Content: OK, location not so hot, but as my title says, how much time do you really spend in the immediate area anyway? Location in terms of access to restaurants, Metro, etc... was great actually. Just not too thrilled with the homeless people begging and the sex shops nearby (my 12 y.o. got a good education!). Room was great, kitchen area very nice (no dishwasher and $25 bill if you leave dishes. Soap, sponge and distowels provided). Workout area lame, as someone mentioned. I was Ok with my 12 y.o., not so good for families with younger kids-maybe too much for teenagers? Parking an extra $15. Metro cheap and so much easier, so we were fine with leaving our car parked. We were out most of the time, stopped by the room for a snack, off again, etc.. so the location was not an issue for us, but I can understand how it may be for others. We plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Location”
Reviews.Author: CowGirl11
Reviews.Content: The good - hotel was clean and service and assistance for suggestions could be better. The bad - location was questionable to say the least. The hotel is located in the middle of a street that has shops that have closed down on either side. The street is quite dirty, its the type of street that if you were to walk down it you would wonder if there are any business open on that street. The buildings located next to the hotel had sheets and other things hanging from the window's on the second floor. Across is a parking lot that does not look like is used very often. The street is not lit very well so it is recommended that you walk in the middle of the street late at night, don't worry about car's driving through, the street is not busy at all in fact I think the only car that drove on this road was a taxi to either drop off or pick up from the hotel. Also, the mattress in the room looked very tired and could do with a change. It was obvious that this room had alot of single sleepers because of the natural dip into the middle of the bed, also the mattress had no support. There is a Days Inn a few blocks down which I would suggest highly based purely on location. The offered complimentary internet but it kept on freezing and crashing on us. We called the front desk to ask about why this was happening, he had no idea.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all respects”
Reviews.Author: Daniel038
Reviews.Content: The hotel lists 5 types of accommodation - one or two bed standard rooms, superior rooms, and junior and executive suites. Our travelocity deal was for the standard room with two beds, which looked very large to me, including the ample, well-stocked kitchenette and spacious bathroom. We were a family of 4 adults, and I had mistakenly reserved only one room instead of two. I asked for an additional cot, but was told that our room was considered too small for it, so we were upgraded to a superior room. This room was huge, and the cot fit in easily. It and the beds were quite comfortable (I tried both on different nights). The upgrade and cot, together, cost an additional 35 CAD per night, which I thought was quite reasonable. We stayed January 14-17, during a cold snap. The temperature was about -10 F. the entire time, but we stayed comfortable. Because of the temperatures, we spent more time in the room than we might have otherwise, preparing three meals there, and it was quite comfortable for the four of us. When we did venture outside, we were fortunate that the Metro station was only about 200 yards away. It is a principal junction, so we could take either line that we needed. Also, there is a large, warm underground shopping area at this station - though we found the shops, restaurants, and bars above ground, on St. Denis, more to our liking. Everything about the hotel was excellent. It was inaugurated in 2005. I am not sure that the building is that new, but nothing seemed old or in need of repair. With St. Denis a 5-minute walk, who needs frills? We had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “What an unexpected pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Russjuly17
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Orbitz. When asked to enter a Promotion Code I googled and found found 75.00 off and also free parking. Free breakfast was also included. This hotel was very clean, well staffed, and provided a great breakfast. It was located in a great spot. The Metro was almost right out the door, and the village where it is located in was great. The city of Montreal is a wonderful place. It felt like I went to Paris, yet we drove!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: HayesAus
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful, breakfast was acceptable (but not great), location was a bit out of town, but was close to a metro station, and a 30 minute stroll to everywhere by foot. Room was ok, the hallway did have a bit of weird smell, but was not noticable in the room. Internet access was available via a wired connection, patch cable supplied at the front desk - which was quite good (i wasnt expectating it for the price we were paying) On the whole, we thought this place was quite good for the price. We were worried by another review which stated there was prosititues and drug dealers on the street, but we saw none of this. At least no more than the homeless we saw elsewhere in montreal. The other thing worth mentioning is about montreal in general... unless your an artsy-fartsy type person that likes modern "art" that looks like its been pained by a 3-legged dog while stoned... montreal probably wont be a place for you. If you are artsy-fartsy.... and asthentics etc instead of fucntionality are important to you - then this hotel might not be for you

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: magentaOttawa
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for good value for a stay in Montreal - I definately would recommend this hotel. The suite was roomy enough, the bathrooms were very spacious and clean. It must have just undergone renovations because everything looked so new and clean. The location is good - the street it self looks a bit rough - but it is very close to St. Catherine Street. Even though the rooms all have full kitchettes - breakfast is inlcuded in the price! Breakfast was definately NOT fancy - but fast and conveinient. Parking is also in the building for an extra fee. Although it is not luxury (the towels are really cheap) for Montreal - this is a good find and I would definately return to Les Suites Labelle.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: purplefin
Reviews.Content: Great no-frills hotel in a fantastic location. Easy walk to Old Montreal to the waterfront, Notre Dame, and Rue de Saint Paul. On the other side, easy walk to Rue de Saint Dennis and train station. Very easy location to find taxis as well. Hotel rooms are clean have basic amenities - don't expect anything fancy or any bells and whistles. Rooms are adequate size if you don't plan on spending much time in the room. Daily breakfast is well worth it as well.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaNY3
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based mostly on price, secondly location. The room was large (with kitchenette/dining table), clean and the beds comfortable. The staff were friendly. Breakfast was good, with eggs, potatoes and sausage, as well as sweet rolls, cereal, fresh fruit and good coffee (the only drawback was that it was exactly the same every day). The neighborhood was a little seedy, but the hotel's only a block away from one of the main metro stations, which made getting around to different parts of town easy.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: FellowTraveler_8
Reviews.Content: Room was very clean, mini kitchen was a nice feature (fully stocked with pots, pans, dishes, etc.) though clean up after yourself or pay a charge of $25.00, bathroom was a nice size and very clean. The block this hotel is in looks a little sketchy, though we had no problems. Parking in the hotel ramp was no problem and the $15.00 additional per day was worth it for we didn't use the car once being so close to a main Metro stop. Nearby rue St. Catherine as chock full of various shops, restaraunts and bars and is closed to traffic during the Summer. A very nice experience!

Reviews.Title: “Great Alternative”
Reviews.Author: Larry034
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Les Suites Labelle for 2 nights following our cruise from Ft. Lauderdale. We had spent a couple of nights at Le Square Phillips in October, 2006, before leaving on another cruise but this time we wanted something less expensive. We found the room and kitchenette to be spacious, clean and quiet. The included breakfast is tasty, wholesome and plentiful. While the immediate neighborhood is somewhat tacky with some porn and souvenir shops, we enjoyed the University of Quebec setting and eclectic populace. Most of the central city is within walking distance and the metro stop is within half a block of the hotel. The staff is friendly and accommodating but firm. They strictly enforce the no smoking rule with fines and while we were there, they expelled a group of young people who had caused a late night disturbance. We appreciated the "no nonsense" approach to decorum. The desk clerk Erick was particularly courteous and helpful when we arrived in mid-morning but equally firm in dealing with the disruptive guests. We were especially pleased to find the bus station was just a block away as we took the Greyhound to Burlington, VT for our rental car. We found Labelle to be a great alternative to the higher priced hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: grandhold
Reviews.Content: The area is a little shady, but close to the Metro, and stores. I stayed here during the Canadian Grand Prix, because it was the cheapest place I could find, close to the action. I still paid nearly $200/night. My friends stayed at the Marriott for close to $600/ night, since every city on the F1 calender screws the fans on hotel costs. Since I was alone it was not too bad. The hotel has been updated and was clean. The free breakfast was ok and the room was nice, but the bed was hard. The top floor has tables and a great view of the city where you can hang out outside and no one seemed to use it much.

Reviews.Title: “good bang for the buck”
Reviews.Author: dude1970
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week in september 2007. it is in a great location for the site seeker. very close to the main subway terminal and close to all sorts of emenities. I never saw too much in the way of vagrants like others have quoted here. but like any north american city you'll see them anywhere so I guess it wasn't all that shocking to me. It is clean, quiet, and comfortable. The breakfast was a continental breakfast and was great for someone who would be on the go. The kitchenette came in handy when we were too tired to go out to eat and the staff were very helpful and accomidating. I will stay there agin on my next visit to montreal. Glynn Morrissey, Clarkes Beach, Newfoundland

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, Pathetic Location.”
Reviews.Author: Binkey
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was ok for the money but the breakfast that was included was lousy. The location is downright sad. Prostitutes, drunks, bums and addicts riddled the streets and literally slept right outside our hotel. Their parking garage was full so we had to have our car outside exsposed to the criminal element which was in abundance. I literally feared going outside by myself as I think I would of been mugged. Our party was approached by prostitues for a "good time". needless to say I was not impressed. if it was legal to carry guns here in Canada I would of defintely carried a piece when staying at this lousy hotel. I will NEVER return to this hotel ever again. I cannot say enough bad things about this hotels location.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly great room”
Reviews.Author: travelinggirlie
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at the Hotel Les Suites Labelle just over fall break and it was fantastic. Our suite room with kitchen was fully stocked. The room was very clean. The staff was incredibly friendly and gave advice on restaurants and nightlife areas. One staff member only gave me a pamphlet when I asked for advice, but otherwise they were all very helpful. The area can be considered to be a little dodgey, but even then we were within walking distance to clubs, shopping, restaurants. The gym was a bit subpar with just a treadmill, weight equipment, and two stationary bikes in a little room. There was a mounting for a hanging tv, but no tv. The hotel's amenities would be perfect if the mini gym was fixed up a bit more. But all in all it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay... Hate the city”
Reviews.Author: PearlyGirlTraveler
Reviews.Content: Ewww... so the hotel itself was not too bad, but it's location was another thing. We were sitting outside our first night smoking a cigarette and this guy asked us to use our lighter. We let him, not knowing he was going to light a crack pipe with it! He gave us the lighter back and then walked down the street smoking it. We threw the lighter away. The hotel itself is down a shady street that smells of piss. If you walk to the right is the gay village, and to the left is the shopping district. Homeless people everywhere and a lot of real shady characters. I was clutching my purse the whole time. Many of the people in the shops were quite rude to us (maybe because we were American?). Everything is very pricey, and unfortunately at the time of our trip the Canadian dollar was worth more than the US for the first time in like 30 years. I guess you'd be in paradise if you liked drugs and sex shops because there was certaintly a lot of this... not our thing. NEVER take children here, for the love of God. From what we saw Old Montreal wasn't anything special either, although we weren't here long because it was pouring rain. Very hard to drive around and find parking without paying a fortune. Got stuck behind some nasty looking horse drawn carriages going 5 mph. The parking garage at the hotel was insane. 15 dollars a day (and you definently don't want to leave your car on this street) and I have never seen a more narrow garage. One car can barely fit down and there are very sharp turns. You have to back up if there is another car trying to come down or up. It is frightening. We never ate the breakfast buffet. It's 7.50 a person. Actually, we only had one good meal in the city. It was at an Italian place called Guido and Angela. AWESOME pizza. Overall, the hotel rooms were okay and there was a terrace on the 9th floor you could overlook the disgusting city below. I will NEVER EVER go back to this city. Worst trip of my life.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodation at a great price - A++”
Reviews.Author: Srivi_Gowri
Reviews.Content: We were two families (4 adults, 3 children) that stayed in the hotel for 3 nights ealier this week. Overall, excellent experience. 1. Nice front desk crew 2. Great location 3. Reasonable price 4. Clean rooms 5. Good breakfast menu 6. Very nice kitchen set and excellent amenities Highly Recommended!! Regards, Gowri, Voorhees NJ

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is perfect, but location is not for everyone”
Reviews.Author: Volanges
Reviews.Content: Everything worked smoothly with our hotel. We drove from NY and chose to park in the hotel's basement (15$/day), which was worth it because the hotel is located on a very empty street frequented by drug addicts (we witnessed a couple of young people smoking crack at a parking lot across the street in the middle of the day). The desk staff was very friendly and accomodating. The hotel is spotless and well maintained and feels safe inside. Our room was perfect if a bit dark, but there was a kitchenette with a mini fridge and our bed was comfortable. There is a gym on the 9th floor and breakfast is included in the rate. The location is very convenient: only two blocks from the gay village and a 5 minute walk from Old Montreal. There is a subway station one block away as well. The only downside is the street where the hotel is located. As I mentioned above, drug dealers hang out in the parking lots and there are almost no store fronts on the street, which means it can be very quiet and isolated. Even though we are two Manhattanites, we were surprised by the open use of drugs and even witnessed a drug sale on St. Catherine Street in the middle of the day. One night returning late, two blocks away from the hotel we saw what we naively thought was an ice cream truck, but instead it was a needle exchange bus. If you are not comfortable with this, then you should avoid the area. But if you are more open minded and are willing to sacrifice a beautiful location for a low hotel price, then this is the place for you. We would definitely go back, and we saw entire families with children at the hotel.
